title: Is the concept of self compatible with how Socrates conceived of the self? - Quora

response.answer_text: I guess it all depends on how you define self, but a common historical claim is that Socrates invented the idea of the “soul” as a your moral aspect and your development morally as having the parts of your soul, mind, emotion, and appetite,all working in harmony.

Yes. But the modern concept of self actually derives from the Italian Renaissance, not from ancient Greece. Think of Michelangelo’s statue of David as the metaphorical realization of that age. The European Enlightenment that followed that era built upon that legacy.
